Blaze 
Damage per stack increased to 4% of target's maximum health from 2%.



One of the worst buffs i have ever seen in my life.

> [{quoted}](name=Setsuna F,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=MAgijO9p,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-06-25T06:25:44.605+0000)

> One of the worst buffs i have ever seen in my life.

Its even worse when you consider his passive actually can stack 3 times, so from 6% total it goes to 12%.

Absurd.
Each stack refreshes the duration, it doesn't add to it so 12% would be only if he waits for each stack to end and then applying the next one which he doesn't do.
tbh, it doesnt matter either way since his burst is easy to hit and on a fairly short cooldown.

Actually (just checked in practice tool), it refreshes the duration AND adds another 4% tick. So one stack is 4%, two stacks is two times 4%, and three stacks three times 4%. They act as seperate max health ticks. For example, at two stacks, it's 2 seperate ticks of 4% max health, rather than on tick of 8% max health.
Nope, not until they make him viable in mid again
Same. As a Brand mid player I hope they adjust his power rather just nerfing him flat out and balancing him as a support.
Nerf base damage, buff ratios?

Won't work. Will just shove him even further in support position. The problem with Brand mid is he runs out of mana and can't waveclear. His laning is garbage and that is why he isn't played there. How would nerfing his lane even further push him to go mid?

Yeah. They should probably increase his mana cost or cooldown on his W and then give him some sort of mana or cooldown refund for killing minions with it.  Would help him lane and reduce his power as support.

Adding a mana refund on W will do nothing. The problem with Brand is until an item and a half it will ALWAYS take Brand AT LEAST 2 abilities to ever kill casters while being incredibly short ranged.

Another point is that even IF they buff him to help him lane in a farming position he's.....still going to go bot lane except he is going to be in the carry role instead of support which he is ALREADY doing in 7% of the games he is in and that number would only grow.
With the way Brand's kit is, allowing him to clear with one ability would make him rather uninteractive. Similar to how Lux was never allowed to be able to oneshot minions with just E

I'm just saying that adding a mana refund on W would do nothing. It would have to be on E. The problem with that however is after Ludens you DO kill casters with W meaning you lose out on the mana refund at basically any stage AFTER laning phase which is where mages tend to start running out of mana nowadays as well. The only OTHER solution is to put it on Blaze itself, but that is arguably too universal and could have other problems associated with it. Regardless my point still stands that as long as Brand's overall kit remains the same he isn't leaving bot lane. He simply doesn't have an ultimate in mid unless he gets ganked or the enemy is dumb enough to sit in the creep wave which is ALREADY a bad idea because of a W.
Fair point. As for the ult in mid situation, it's uh....good against LB at least lmao
As a mid brand main, you have my upvote
The ONLY way Brand will ever be viable mid is by making his Q go through the minion wave. Is that really what you want?

Absolutely not. At one point he was a solid mid laner even though his Q didn't pass through minions. That was a long time ago. Even then he was beginning to show his age with mobility creep.

Then people began playing him support after it popped up in LCS. There was a mage support meta. Riot reworked him, but they offed a lot of his lane bully potential in favor of teamfight burst. That just grounded his support playstyle even more. Recently, with the buff to his per stack dmg, they made his mid lane a big stronger, but, because he still largely retains his kit from the past (outside of passive change) he still can't keep up with the mobility creep.

To make him a mid laner, they probably need to rework him. The W (despite it being infamous in bot lane) and Q telegraph (Q especially; slow af for a skillshot) aren't enough for today's standards. However, he has enough power in his kit that he would be really, really low on the rework priority list

I checked a bunch skillshots in the game and Brand Q was the fastest skillshot I could personally find. It's clocking in at 1550 which is 250 units/sec faster than Nidalee Spear. It's almost double the speed of Zed shuriken.

Seems weird that there's nothing for projectile speed. For some champs it's not even listed, idk.

There's a couple of things faster than Brand's Q, but the point is that he's super dependent on landing a skillshot that champs can easily _dodge_ his W is also delayed, and his E is crap.

Faster projectiles: Lee Q, Ahri Q, Mumu Q,  Corki R, Mundo Q, Elise E

Side note, why is he poorly designed, why is just innately doing damage poorly designed, that is literally every assassin.

Ok so it's obvious that he needs a nerf, no one has suggested a compensation in this thread, but the first step is getting riot to acknowledge that he needs a nerf. So that's step one at the moment.

Secondly, there was a post on the boards today:
(https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/81zTAxWE-the-boards-sucks-at-comparing-champions)
That highlighted people like you who make bad comparisons, clearly not understanding the different roles/designs/archetypes and the fact that not everything can be put side by side for a point of reference.
Comparing Brand to assassins is apples and oranges.

Why he is poorly designed is because he gets a lot of extra damage simply because he landed abilities, which is a pretty poor justification for the amount of damage that he deals.
With his passive, he's easily able to deal 24% of your hp in magic damage for free; no scaling, no ap, just pure and free base damage because you land a combo at level 3, if you don't count the flat damage those abilities do with their individual scalings.
Now of course, other champions have %hp damage, but they usually have it because it doesn't scale, and it's on a champion who doesn't build damage. 
When it does scale, and to a very high degree like brand, it's usually single target, not AoE, and probably has another condition, like being in melee range for Elises venomous bite, or having to build crit to maximise/get the full potential output of kindreds mounting dread.

Take a look at this: (http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Health) and scroll down to the list of "Scaling from enemy health", and one thing you'll notice is that it's very rare for a champion to have %hp damage like brands passive. The only other abilities comparable to brands passive are Gnars "Hyper" passive and Kalistas "Sentinal" passive, both of which are in no way even close to the level or potential of damage from brands "blaze", and have pretty reasonable constraints tied to them. It is entirely his passive, blaze, which is the issue, as we can see almost every thread that complains about brand doing to much damage, focusing on this specific aspect of brands kit, which was recently buffed to deal double the damage. (2% max hp to 4% max hp)

Brand is super viable early, and scales really well, while having great teamfighting ability: the buff to his innate passive, while it had good intentions, really makes for an unbalanced amount of damage.

Am I here to suggest what happens once he receives a nerf? Clearly not. But I believe it's pretty clear that he is in need of a nerf.

Each ability burns for 4% that can stack up to three times meaning he would have to hit three spells. A Brand is never going to start with their point and click ability, it is also one of the last things they level and if they just hard cast it first, they are heavily hampering their damage. They have to land their skillshot pillar, then skillshot sear before landing their point and click to actually and actively do the most damage possible.

2. Uhhh... what? I'm going to ignore that because not only did I not mention that but, I don't think the two are comparable so... yeah

3. Because assassins have a completely different playstyle, build, and role in the game. They also have completely different powerspikes, ability sets, and skill levels. 
Usually when you talk about balance in a game, there are examples that you can use as a metaphorical seesaw to represent how underpowered or how overpowered a certain thing is. Brand on the other hand excels at teamfighting due to his AoE damage potential. Ironically, this is actually mentioned in the "countering" part of brands strategy on the wiki: 
"Assassins like Fizz, LeBlanc, Zed, and Talon are the most reliable way to get rid of Brand. However, they tend to have poor teamfighting presence, while Brand excels at teamfighting, especially if he gets protection from his allies."
